result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher P Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office in a payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning November 1, 2015, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights are restored.
Tribe to determine who is eligible to vote in Tribal elections.
